title: Can search engine spiders see content I add using jQuery?
body:
<p>Despite what is being stated here in other answers and totally <a href="http://www.google.com/support/customsearch/bin/answer.py?answer=72366">contrary to Google&#39s own FAQ</a>, a Google employee named JohnMu answered a question recently in Google Groups about how the GoogleBot came to follow a non-existent URL.  (The actual URL was contained within the jQuery code itself and the <strong>GoogleBot DID try to follow it</strong>.)</p>

<p><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5749348/jquery-causing-404-errors-in-webmaster-tools-on-a-directory">jQuery causing 404 errors in Google Webmaster Tools</a></p>

<p><a href="http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Webmasters/thread?fid=3102f0a5f6e219ac0004a1f75422344b&amp;hl=en">Google Employee explains how JavaScript and jQuery are indexed</a></p>

<p>Apparently, Google does attempt to index your JavaScript.</p>

<p><strong>Quote Google&#39s JohnMu:</strong></p>

<blockquote>
  <p>"I would also recommend not explicitly
  disallowing crawling of the jQuery
  file. While we generally wouldn&#39t
  index it on its own, <strong>we may need to
  access it to generate good Instant
  Previews</strong> for your site."</p>
</blockquote>

<p>JohnMu later in the same thread...</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>"Additionally, we&#39re constantly <strong>working
  on improving processing of JavaScript
  for web-search in general</strong>, so if you
  use jQuery to pull in content, and the
  jQuery script is disallowed for
  Googlebot, then we would not be able
  to look at that at all."</p>
</blockquote>

title: Why does my JTable sort an integer column incorrectly?
body:
<p>Well, the docs for DefaultTableModel do state:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>Warning: DefaultTableModel returns a column class of Object. When DefaultTableModel is used with a TableRowSorter this will result in extensive use of toString, which for non-String data types is expensive. If you use DefaultTableModel with a TableRowSorter you are strongly encouraged to override getColumnClass to return the appropriate type.</p>
</blockquote>

<p>So it sounds like it&#39s just going to be converting values to strings, which would be consistent with what you&#39re seeing.</p>

<p>Have you tried either overriding <code>getColumnClass()</code> or calling <code>setComparator()</code> for the appropriate <code>TableRowSorter</code>?</p>

title: For a new project using Spring with JDBCTemplates, iBatis/myBatis or Hibernate?
body:
<p>Hibernate offers you nice and easy way to map native SQL queries in addition to ORM while iBatis offers only SQL mapping. So with Hibernate you have more options and can use ORM or native SQL when needed. For that reason I prefer Hibernate.</p>

<p>Hibernate definitelly integrates well with Spring. iBatis probably does as well but I never used such integration.</p>

<p>These are my two cents. If someone has different opinion, please post another answer.</p>

title: what is the best way to count collection of dates by quarter
body:
<p>Pure LINQ, using <code>GroupBy</code>:</p>

<pre><code>var result = Events
    .Select(d =&gt; new \{ DateTime = d, Q = (d.Month - 1) / 3 \})
    .GroupBy(a =&gt; new \{ a.Q, a.DateTime.Year \})
    .Select(a =&gt; new QuarterInfo
        \{
            Events = a.Select(s =&gt; s.DateTime),
            QuarterOfYear = a.Key.Q + 1
        \});
</code></pre>

title: converting an if statement to a switch statement
body:
<p>You have to enumerate every case for a switch. The compiler converts this to a jump table, so you can&#39t use ranges. You can, however, have multiple cases use the same block of code, which may be closer to what you want.</p>

<pre><code>switch(num) \{
    case 41:
    case 42:
    case 43:
    case 44:
    case 45:
    case 46:
    case 47:
    case 48:
    case 49:
        printf("correct!");
        break;
    default:
        break;
\}
</code></pre>

title: In MS SQL how to split a column into rows with no delimiter
body:
<p>You could join the table to a list of numbers, and use <code>substring</code> to split data column into rows:</p>

<pre><code>declare @YourTable table (data varchar(50))
insert @YourTable 
          select &#39abcde&#39 
union all select &#39fghe&#39

; with  nrs as
        (
        select  max(len(data)) as i
        from    @YourTable
        union all
        select  i - 1
        from    nrs
        where   i &gt; 1
        )
select  substring(yt.data, i, 1)
from    nrs
join    @YourTable yt
on      nrs.i &lt; len(yt.data)
option  (maxrecursion 0)
</code></pre>

title: How can express this imperative function in a functional, array-based language like K (or Q)?
body:
<p>In <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clojure" rel="nofollow">Clojure</a> (a dialect of <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisp_%28programming_language%29" rel="nofollow">Lisp</a>):</p>

<pre><code>(defn minmax [x y](map #(vector (- (apply max %1) %2) (- (apply min %1) %2)))(partition-all 4 1 x) y)

(minmax [1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8] [0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0])
</code></pre>

<p>will give</p>

<p>[([4 1] [5 2] [6 3] [7 4] [8 5] [8 6] [8 7] [8 8])`(result 1, result 2) as output..</p>

<p>Then</p>

<pre><code>(map #(first %1) result) is result1
(map #(last %1) result) is result2
</code></pre>

title: How to layout aspx page that looks like a paper form?
body:
<p>Here&#39s a non-table example:</p>

<p><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/eRY8T/7/" rel="nofollow">http://jsfiddle.net/eRY8T/7/</a></p>

<p>The conventional wisdom is that <code>table</code> should be used for displaying data in tabular format, not for laying out forms. </p>

<p>In practice I think it is sometimes easier to use tables for forms - but this is typically when your form looks like tabular data (e.g. one column for labels, another for inputs).</p>

<p>In your situation, I think using divs is actually easier than tables would be. This would probably require lots of rowspan/colspan/nested tables to get right.</p>

<p>The other advantage of using a CSS based layout over tables is that the tab order will probably make more sense. In the example, notice how tab goes through the first column then the 2nd one. In a table it would go through every input on a given row before moving to the next row.</p>

title: Get distinct list between two lists in C#
body:
<p>If you want to get items from the first list except items in the second list, use</p>

<pre><code>list1.Except(list2)
</code></pre>

<p>If you want to get items that are in the first list or in the second list, but not both, you can use</p>

<pre><code>list1.Except(list2).Concat(list2.Except(list1))
</code></pre>

title: Python: Determine prefix from a set of (similar) strings
body:
<p>Never rewrite what is provided to you:  os.path.commonprefix does exactly this:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>os.path.commonprefix(list):  Return the longest path prefix (taken
  character-by-character) that is a prefix of all paths in list. If list
  is empty, return the empty string (&#39&#39). Note that this may return
  invalid paths because it works a character at a time.</p>
</blockquote>

<p>For comparison to the other answers, here&#39s the code:</p>

<pre><code># Return the longest prefix of all list elements.
def commonprefix(m):
    "Given a list of pathnames, returns the longest common leading component"
    if not m: return &#39&#39
    s1 = min(m)
    s2 = max(m)
    for i, c in enumerate(s1):
        if c != s2[i]:
            return s1[:i]
    return s1
</code></pre>

title: How can I search a file for all text lines prefaced with numbers in a certain format and move them to a new line

</code></pre>

title: Bad Performance for Dedupe of 2 million records using mapreduce on Appengine
body:
<p>I see 2 ways to approach this problem:</p>

<ol>
<li><p>(If you only need to do it once) AppEngine creates a property index for every property in your entity (unless you ask it not to do that). Create a backend, run a query "SELECT * FROM  ORDER BY " in batches using cursors, determine duplicated properties and fix/delete those. You might be able to parallelize this, but it&#39s tricky on shard boundaries and you will probably have to write all the code yourself.</p></li>
<li><p>You can use mapper framework to do it slower, but run in parallel. This approach also allows you to efficiently dedupe data on insert. Introduce a new entity to hold unique property values. Say "UniquePhoneNumber". The entity should hold a phone number as a key and a reference to the entity with this phone number. Now run a map and do a lookup for UniquePhoneNumber. If it&#39s found and its reference is valid, delete the duplicate. If not create a new one with correct reference. This way it&#39s even possible to repoint a reference to the other one, if you need to. Make sure that you read UniquePhoneNumber and create a new one/update a new one inside a single transaction. Otherwise duplicates won&#39t be detected.</p></li>
</ol>

title: SQL Table Schema question
body:
<p>Adding the name of the table to each column can be helpful in a few different situations-</p>

<ul>
<li><p>When you join 2 tables which would otherwise share several column names, it saves you from having to assign aliases to distinguish columns</p></li>
<li><p>I tend to use database column names throughout my web applications to maintain consistency; I&#39ll keep the column name in form fields, variables, etc which deal with the same data item.  In larger databases with over 100 tables, it helps me stay organized having the table name prefixed on the variable.  Not to mention, it can help someone who&#39s new to a project if they can see which table a variable came from.</p></li>
<li><p>When you&#39re specifying a foreign key in a table, it helps immensely if you have a naming convention which specifies which table the key belongs to.  There&#39s nothing worse than seeing a foreign key and not knowing which table it is supposed to belong to.</p></li>
</ul>

<p>The only downside to prefixing columns with the table name is that it can get a bit lengthy.</p>

title: Use jQuery UI buttons with jEditables

The plugin should really support <code>onbeforeedit</code> and <code>onafteredit</code> or something, for pre and post rendering. But it doesn&#39t.</p>

<p>So you can add that functionality really easily. Or workaround it with a simple click handler:</p>

<p><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/EU8ce/3/" rel="nofollow">http://jsfiddle.net/EU8ce/3/</a></p>

<p>Since you call <code>editable()</code> first, it&#39ll bind the click handler first, so subsequent handlers will execute after, which has the effect of being a post-render callback, and you can execute your <code>button()</code> code there.</p>

title: How to hit java.lang.OutOfMemoryError by spawning threads?
body:
<p>Also take a look at the same problem which is covered in the JavaSpecialists Newsletter # 149
<a href="http://www.javaspecialists.eu/archive/Issue149.html" rel="nofollow">http://www.javaspecialists.eu/archive/Issue149.html</a></p>

<p>Here is a small piece of code that you can run to find out how many inactive threads you can start on your JVM:</p>

<pre><code>import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;

public class ThreadCreationTest \{
  public static void main(String[] args)
      throws InterruptedException \{
    final AtomicInteger threads_created = new AtomicInteger(0);
    while (true) \{
      final CountDownLatch latch = new CountDownLatch(1);
      new Thread() \{
        \{ start(); \}
        public void run() \{
          latch.countDown();
          synchronized (this) \{
            System.out.println("threads created: " +
                threads_created.incrementAndGet());
            try \{
              wait();
            \} catch (InterruptedException e) \{
              Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
            \}
          \}
        \}
      \};
      latch.await();
    \}
  \}
\}
</code></pre>

title: Manual Linked List - Insert before method
body:
<p>First things first: <code>for</code> loops are generally a bad idea with linked lists. <code>while</code> loops are much better; you can do something like <code>while(next != null)</code>. </p>

<p>Looking at your code, you seem to have a few problems.</p>

<p>Your for loop is overly complicated, and doesn&#39t seem to make a lot of sense. Here&#39s how your loop should look:</p>

<ol>
<li>Get head node</li>
<li>Begin looping through the list, checking the next node&#39s value as you go</li>
<li>Once you find that the next node&#39s value is the one you&#39re looking for, creating a new node.</li>
<li>Insert the new node by setting its Next value to be equal to the current node&#39s Next value, then set the current node&#39s next value to be the new node.</li>
<li>Return from the function.</li>
</ol>

<p>Your middle bullet point is actually unnecessary, and I have no idea what you use <code>end</code> for. Regardless, you seem to have the basic principle down, so I won&#39t feel like I&#39m spoiling you by posting code.</p>

<p>Now, I&#39m not sure what your <code>start</code> is. Does it hold a value, or is it a dedicated head node? I&#39d vote for a dedicated head node, I generally find it easier to work with because you don&#39t need to add code for a special case where the number should come before the head. So your start node should be "empty"; the value it holds is ignored, the only thing it&#39s used for is to keep a pointer to the first legit node in the list. If you do this, the insertBef method becomes incredibly simple. NOTE: untested code to follow.</p>

<pre><code>public void insertBef(char ref, char data)
\{
    Node current = start;

    while( current.next != null )
    \{
        if( current.next.value == ref )
        \{
            Node n = new Node(data);
            n.next = current.next;
            current.next = n;
            return;
        \}

        current = current.next;
    \}
\}
</code></pre>

<p>Please don&#39t just copy the code. If you have questions, post them and I&#39ll do my best to answer. </p>

title: XSD Import to use foaf in the XSL-Schema
body:
<p>I would not go there. XML Schema isn&#39t really a good tool for dealing with RDF data. Many people look at RDF&#39s XML serialization and think, “oh so it&#39s just like XML with some extra rdf:this and rdf:that attributes thrown in.” But that&#39s deceptive.</p>

<p>RDF is a set of subject-predicate-object triples. There are multiple syntaxes for writing these triples down into files. RDF/XML is one of them; Turtle and N-Triples and RDFa are others.</p>

<p>The problem with RDF/XML is that there are many different ways of writing down the same set of triples in an RDF/XML file. For example, the following two snippets are <em>exactly</em> equivalent:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;foaf:Person rdf:about="#cygri"&gt;
    &lt;foaf:nick&gt;cygri&lt;/foaf:nick&gt;
&lt;/foaf:Person&gt;

&lt;rdf:Description rdf:ID="cygri"&gt;
    &lt;rdf:type rdf:resource="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person"&gt;
    &lt;foaf:nick&gt;cygri&lt;/foaf:nick&gt;
&lt;/foaf:Person&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>In summary: My recommendation is <em>not</em> to use XML tools to process RDF data. Use RDF tools. To extend an RDF Schema like FOAF, use RDF Schema.</p>

title: Best python style for complex one-liners
body: <p>To me multi-line version is much better. With multi-line code you break up the logic and use variables to store intermediate output. The variable names then allow me to read the logic and see what my output depends on. Also you don&#39t have to write elaborate comments in this case. I find it easier to read the multi-line version after some months than read the single line version in such cases. The example you posted is not complex, but just to keep consistency I would have written your example code in multiple lines. </p>

title: Zend Config Ini Caching
body:
<p>Yes, they are parsed every time unless you cache them. It really saves time (i checked it in my own project). </p>

<p>So how do you use <code>Zend_Cache_Frontend_File</code> to cache an ini file? Well I can provide you with an example. In my project I have route.ini file that contains a number of custom routes:</p>

<p><strong>routes.ini</strong></p>

<pre><code>routes.showacc.route = "/@show/:city/:id/:type"
routes.showacc.type = "Zend_Controller_Router_Route" 
routes.showacc.defaults.module = default
routes.showacc.defaults.controller = accommodation
routes.showacc.defaults.action = show
routes.showacc.defaults.city = 
routes.showacc.defaults.type = 
routes.showacc.defaults.id = 
routes.showacc.defaults.title = 
routes.showacc.reqs.id = "E&#39\\&#39d+" 

;and more
</code></pre>

<p>In my <strong>Bootstrap.php</strong> I load them using cache (if possible):</p>

<pre><code>protected function _initMyRoutes() \{
    $this-&gt;bootstrap(&#39frontcontroller&#39);
    $front = Zend_Controller_Front::getInstance();
    $router = $front-&gt;getRouter();

    // get cache for config files
    $cacheManager = $this-&gt;bootstrap(&#39cachemanager&#39)-&gt;getResource(&#39cachemanager&#39);
    $cache = $cacheManager-&gt;getCache(&#39configFiles&#39);
    $cacheId = &#39routesini'

    // $t1 = microtime(true);
    $myRoutes = $cache-&gt;load($cacheId);

    if (!$myRoutes) \{
        // not in cache or route.ini was modified.
        $myRoutes = new Zend_Config_Ini(APPLICATION_PATH . &#39/configs/routes.ini&#39);
        $cache-&gt;save($myRoutes, $cacheId);
    \}
    // $t2 = microtime(true);
    // echo ($t2-$t1); // just to check what is time for cache vs no-cache scenerio

    $router-&gt;addConfig($myRoutes, &#39routes&#39);
\}
</code></pre>

<p>The cache is setup in my <strong>application.ini</strong> as follows</p>

<pre><code>resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontend.name = File
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontend.customFrontendNaming = false
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontend.options.lifetime = false
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontend.options.automatic_serialization = true
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontend.options.master_files[] = APPLICATION_PATH "/configs/routes.ini"    
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.backend.name = File
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.backend.customBackendNaming = false
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.backend.options.cache_dir = APPLICATION_PATH "/../cache"
resources.cachemanager.configFiles.frontendBackendAutoload = false
</code></pre>

<p>Hope this helps.</p>

title: Entity Framework 3.5 - how to update row without first loading it from database
body:
<p><strong>Edit</strong> - samples modified for EFv1 - it answers both your questions: </p>

<p>You are looking for this:</p>

<pre><code>private void SaveUser(User user)
\{
    // Attach dummy entity - it must have only primary key property and EntityKey 
    // property assigned
    _db.USERs.Attach(new User() \{ ... \});
    // Apply current values to dummy entity - this will mark the entity as modified
    // and it will also mark all properties (except key and store generated) as modified
    _db.ApplyPropertyChanges("UserSetName", user);
    _db.SaveChanges();
\}
</code></pre>

<p>There is some difference between <code>EntityObject</code>s (today mostly obsolete) and POCOs (only EFv4) where POCO simply updates if it is marked as modified but <code>EntityObject</code> doesn&#39t. It will update only if properties differ to its original state or if property is manually set as modified in <code>ObjectStateEntry</code>.</p>

<p>Selectively defining which properties must be updated is the same as manually assigning them:</p>

<pre><code>private void SaveUser(User user)
\{
    _db.USERs.Attach(user);
    ObjectStateEntry entry = _db.ObjectStateManager.GetObjectStateEntry(user);
    entry.SetModifiedProperty("PropertyName");
    // set other properties
    _db.SaveChanges();
\}
</code></pre>

<p>Btw. have you heard about naming conventions?</p>

title: VC++ project type
body:
<p>If you are reading the vcproj file as an XML document then you should see an element that looks something like this ... </p>

<pre><code>    &lt;Configuration
        Name="Debug|Win32"
        OutputDirectory="$(SolutionDir)$(ConfigurationName)"
        IntermediateDirectory="$(ConfigurationName)"
        ConfigurationType="1"
        CharacterSet="1"
        &gt;
</code></pre>

<p>The ConfigurationType attribute is what you are looking for I think.  Note that there is a separate Cpnfiguration element for each Configuration name (Debug, Release, etc.) and each Platform (Win32, x64, IA64, etc.) in your project.</p>

<p>The problem with reading and writing raw XML is that definitions can change over time.  Not very likely with a released product like Visual Studio 2008.  Perhaps not even likely in a future Visual Studio release, but not impossible. </p>

<p>You might be better using the <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.visualstudio.vcprojectengine.vcconfiguration_members%28v=VS.90%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">VCConfiguration object</a> to manipulate the <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.visualstudio.vcprojectengine.vcconfiguration.configurationtype%28v=VS.90%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">ConfigurationType property</a> to achieve your ends.</p>

title: Parent Node Stalling On MPI_Barrier
body:
<p>Other than fixing a few typos, I get your code to work without issue. I&#39m using openmpi and gnu c compiler on an IBM cluster. I&#39m not sure where you put the barrier. Have I guess correctly?</p>

<pre><code>#include "mpi.h"
#include "stdio.h"

int main (int argc, char **argv)
\{
int me, np, q, sendto;
double t0, t1;
MPI_Status status;
MPI_Init(&amp;argc, &amp;argv);
t0 = MPI_Wtime();
MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD,&amp;np);
MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD,&amp;me);
if (np%2 == 1) \{
  MPI_Finalize();
  return 0;
\}
if (me%2 == 1) \{sendto = me - 1;\}
else \{sendto = me + 1;\}
if (me%2 == 0) \{
  MPI_Send(&amp;me, 1, MPI_INT, sendto, me, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
  MPI_Recv(&amp;q, 1, MPI_INT, sendto, sendto, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &amp;status);
\} else \{
  MPI_Recv(&amp;q, 1, MPI_INT, sendto, sendto, MPI_COMM_WORLD,&amp;status);
  MPI_Send(&amp;me,1,MPI_INT,sendto,me,MPI_COMM_WORLD);
\}
MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
printf("Send %d to proc %d, received %d from proc %dE&#39\\&#39n",
   me,sendto,q,sendto);
t1 = MPI_Wtime();
printf("Timing is %gE&#39\\&#39n",t1-t0);
MPI_Finalize();
return 0;
\}
</code></pre>

title: Customise Controls at runtime
body:
<p>The code you posted have several problems:</p>

<ol>
<li><code>listBox1.Items.Add(cntrl.Name);</code> You are adding the control name not the control itself to the collection, and again <code>listBox1.Items.Add(type.Name);</code> added the form type name to the collection.</li>
<li><p>In the code: </p>

<pre><code>Form frm = (Form)Activator.CreateInstance(type);
</code></pre>

<p>You are creating a new Form(s) instance(s) each time and you are not showing them anywhere.</p></li>
</ol>

<p>So How to fix it:</p>

<pre><code>private void button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
\{
    List&lt;Control&gt; controls = new List&lt;Control&gt;();

    Type formtype = typeof(Form);
    foreach (Type type in Assembly.GetExecutingAssembly().GetTypes())
    \{
        if (formtype.IsAssignableFrom(type))
        \{
            Form frm = (Form)Activator.CreateInstance(type);
            controls.Add(frm);//Add the new instance itself to the list
            foreach (Control cntrl in frm.Controls)
            \{
                controls.Add(cntrl);
            \}
            frm.Show();//show the new form created
        \}
    \}

    listBox1.DataSource = controls;
    listBox1.DisplayMember = "Name";//or "Text"
\}
</code></pre>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> Also make sure that <code>colorDialog1</code> is previously initialized and shown to get the  <code>colorDialog1.Color</code> value from it.</p>

<p>I don&#39t know what you are trying to achieve here, but if you want to just get the current instance of the form that is running, you can use <code>Form.ActiveForm</code> for that....</p>

title: How can I apply truncate/hide list items from multiple lists on a page?
body:
<p>For multiple lists, eack with it&#39s own "show / hide", merge those 2 spans and put a control after each list like so:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;ul class="truncateList" data-list-items="2"&gt;
    &lt;li&gt;One&lt;/li&gt;
    ...
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;button class="ShowHideFullLists" type="button"&gt;View All&lt;/button&gt;

&lt;h2&gt;Second list:&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul class="truncateList" data-list-items="4"&gt;
    &lt;li&gt;A 1&lt;/li&gt;
    ...
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;button class="ShowHideFullLists" type="button"&gt;View All&lt;/button&gt;
</code></pre>

<p><br>
Then the following code will work.  <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/ztKUX/2/" rel="nofollow"><strong>See it in action at jsFiddle.</strong></a></p>

<pre><code>$(&#39.ShowHideFullLists&#39).click (ShowHideFullLists);
$(&#39.ShowHideFullLists&#39).click ();  //-- Init list displays.

function ShowHideFullLists () \{
    var showHideBtn = $(this);
    var bShowEm     = showHideBtn.data (&#39bShowEm&#39)  ||  false;

    /*--- Find the list for this button. It is a previous sibling,
        in the HTML.
    */
    var thisBtnsList    = showHideBtn.prev ("ul.truncateList");

    //--- Show either all or the # from the data-list-items attribute.
    ShowItems (thisBtnsList, bShowEm, thisBtnsList.data(&#39listItems&#39));

    //--- Update the show-all flag.
    bShowEm ^= true;
    showHideBtn.data (&#39bShowEm&#39, bShowEm);

    //--- Update the button text.
    if (bShowEm)
        showHideBtn.text (&#39View All&#39);
    else
        showHideBtn.text (&#39View Less&#39);
\}

function ShowItems (parentNode, bShowAll, numVisible) \{

    if (bShowAll)
        parentNode.find ("&gt; li").show ();
    else \{
        parentNode.find ("&gt; li:lt(" +  numVisible    + ")").show ();
        parentNode.find ("&gt; li:gt(" + (numVisible-1) + ")").hide ();
    \}
\}
</code></pre>

<p><br></p>

<hr>

<hr>

<h3>For one button to control all lists...</h3>

<p>Then <code>ShowHideFullLists</code> changes as follows.  <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/ztKUX/" rel="nofollow"><strong>See that in action at jsFiddle.</strong></a> :</p>

<pre><code>ShowHideFullLists ();   //-- Init list displays.

//--- Activate the show/hide button.
$(&#39#ShowHideFullLists&#39).click (ShowHideFullLists);

function ShowHideFullLists () \{
    var showHideBtn = $(&#39#ShowHideFullLists&#39);
    var bShowEm     = showHideBtn.data (&#39bShowEm&#39)  ||  false;

    //--- Loop through all the different lists.
    $("ul.truncateList").each ( function () \{
        /*--- Show all or the number defined in the 
            data-list-items attribute.
        */
        if (bShowEm)
            ShowItems ( $(this), true);
        else \{
            var jThis   = $(this);
            ShowItems (jThis, false, jThis.data (&#39listItems&#39) );
        \}
    \} );

    //--- Update the show-all flag.
    bShowEm ^= true;
    showHideBtn.data (&#39bShowEm&#39, bShowEm);

    //--- Update the button text.
    if (bShowEm)
        showHideBtn.text (&#39View All&#39);
    else
        showHideBtn.text (&#39View Less&#39);
\}
</code></pre>

<p><br>
Also, note the <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/elements.html#embedding-custom-non-visible-data-with-the-data-attributes" rel="nofollow">case-sensitivity and dash-refactoring of HTML 5 <code>data-</code> attributes</a>.</p>

title: Can this be refactored into a single database call?
body:
<p>Use eager loading to pre-fetch associations from your database:</p>

<p>If you&#39re pulling all of your events at once, you could change it to pre-load the location associations for the events:</p>

<pre><code>Event.all      # only loads Event objects from the database

#maybe try...

Event.includes(:locations)    # loads Event objects and their Locations
</code></pre>

<p>If you need events for some other object (like your <code>@number</code> object), you might want to do something like this in your controller, for example:</p>

<pre><code>@number = Number.where(:id =&gt; whatever).includes(:events =&gt; :locations)
</code></pre>

<p>Now, in this example, your <code>@number</code> object will be pulled from the database along with all of it&#39s events and all of those events&#39 locations.</p>

<p>See the Rails guides for a little more info on this: <a href="http://guides.rubyonrails.org/active_record_querying.html#eager-loading-associations" rel="nofollow">http://guides.rubyonrails.org/active_record_querying.html#eager-loading-associations</a></p>

<p><strong>Updated with my answer from the comments</strong>:</p>

<p>Instead of using scopes, at all, you can simply use Ruby to do the work for you and cut ActiveRecord and extra database calls out of the loop.</p>

<p><code>Enumerable#group_by</code> will take a collection and group by some attribute you provide.  In this case, you could take all of your Events, group by the city and state, and then iterate over the hash it returns:</p>

<pre><code>events = Event.all
events.group_by \{ |e| "#\{e.city\}, #\{e.state\}" \}
# =&gt; \{"Birmingham, AL" =&gt; [&lt;event&gt;, &lt;event&gt;, &lt;event&gt;], "Nashville, TN" =&gt; [&lt;event&gt;, &lt;event&gt;]\}
</code></pre>

<p>Doing this may be a little less pretty than using scopes, but it allows you to make one database call and leave it at that.</p>

title: MJPEG vs. MPEG-4 encoding time
body:
<p>MJPeg is faster theoretically, essentially because there is no inter-frame compression.</p>

<p>However there are ways that MPEG-4 could be faster.  Here are a few factors to consider: </p>

<ul>
<li><p>MPEG-4 can actually be two different formats, either "Part 2" or
"Part 10", and Part 2 is much faster.  See here    for details: 
<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPEG-4_Part_2" rel="nofollow">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPEG-4_Part_2</a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The settings for the encoder can make an order of magnitude<br>
difference.  Fast settings for a given format can be 10x or more<br>
faster than the same format with slower settings (speed/quality<br>
tradeoffs).</p></li>
<li><p>The encoders for MPEG-4 are some of the most optimized pieces of code
on the planet.  They still heavily use assembly language.  They could
easily be faster in practice than another format that is not heavily 
optimized.   </p></li>
<li><p>If your IO is slow (network, hard drive) this can skew the results.<br>
For example having no compression is the fastest right?  But it takes
time to write larger files.</p></li>
</ul>

<p>So in practice, MJPEG could possibly be slower for these reasons and other edge cases.</p>

title: Android app service memory usage issues
body:
<p>Memory is a very precious resource in Android, proper management of Heap Space is very important as the heap size for an Android app can be as low as 16MB (HTC G1).</p>

<ul>
<li>Use logcat effectively to monitor if there are any memory leaks.</li>
<li>Use WeakReference/SoftReference to allow GC to collect more objects (more efficiently).</li>
<li>Use tools like MAT (for eclipse) to pin point leaks.</li>

title: WSO2 Alternative
body:
<p>When you look for "WSO2 Alternative" you need to be precise on which space of WSO2 that you are looking for alternatives. </p>

<p>WSO2 has a complete enterprise middleware stack as well as the same middleware platform as a cloud computing platform as a service offering. </p>

<p>The middleware platform stack, include products such as </p>

<ul>
<li>Application Server</li>
<li>ESB</li>
<li>Business Process Server</li>
<li>and more...</li>
</ul>

<p>There are loads of Apache projects that the WSO2 products are based on, such as Apache Axis2, Apache Synapse, Apache Tomcat, Apache ODE, Apache Rampart and the like. 
One can use these base projects of the WSO2 and use those as alternatives to achieve various aspects of the platform. </p>

<p>You can also use the Eclipse Equinox and P2 projects, used as the base OSGi platform to facilitate the plug and play architecture of WSO2 Carbon base platform. </p>

<p>Note that, all of the products from WSO2 come with Apache 2.0 license. </p>

<p>If you are looking for alternatives other than Apache compatible license, in open source space, you can look for individual products aspects like ESB or BPEL or Application Server. 
Some examples:</p>

<ul>
<li>ESB alternatives: FUSE, Mule</li>
<li>BPEL : Intalio BPM Server</li>
</ul>

<p>If you are looking for <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middleware#Organizations">proprietary alternatives</a> to WSO2 middleware stack you need to look for...
 - IBM 
 - Oracle
 - Redhat  </p>

<p>In the cloud space, a good comparison of the cloud Java Platform as a Service on WSO2 offerings and others can be found at: <a href="http://wso2.org/library/articles/2011/08/comparison-wso2-stratos-other-paas-offerings">http://wso2.org/library/articles/2011/08/comparison-wso2-stratos-other-paas-offerings</a>
That article compares some of the alternatives such as</p>

<ul>
<li>Google App Engine</li>
<li>Amazon Beanstalk</li>
<li>CloudBee&#39s Run@Cloud </li>
</ul>

<p>with WSO2 StratosLive. </p>

title: How can I add on to default events in jqGrid?
body:
<p>You can <code>.bind()</code> your own functions to events, so that your function executes with the event. You could use this to bind different events to each grid, or bind one function to every grid at once.</p>

<p><code>.bind()</code> also allows binding to standard javascript events, custom events, or even undefined strings which you later call with <code>.trigger()</code>.</p>

<p>It needs to be attached after a selector, which can select a specific grid or multiple grids in your case.</p>

<pre><code>$(&#39#Your-Grid-Selector&#39).bind(&#39eventToBind&#39, functiontoBind() \{
            alert(&#39Triggered eventToBind&#39);
        \});
</code></pre>

<p><a href="http://api.jquery.com/bind/" rel="nofollow">jQuery Documentation</a></p>

<p><strong>Edit</strong>: This question may be a duplicate of <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6776696/is-it-possible-to-bind-multiple-event-handlers-to-jqgrid-events-without-overwriti">this SO Question</a>, which has a good solution you can use for this very issue.</p>

title: Why is list when passed without ref to a function acting like passed with ref?
body:
<p>Parameters are passed by value in C# unless they are marked with the <code>ref</code> or <code>out</code> modifiers. For reference types, this means that the reference is passed by value. Therefore, in <code>Fuss</code>, <code>l</code> is referring to the same instance of <code>List&lt;int&gt;</code> as its caller. Therefore, any modifications to this instance of <code>List&lt;int&gt;</code> will be seen by the caller.</p>

<p>Now, if you mark the parameter <code>l</code> with <code>ref</code> or <code>out</code>, then the parameter is passed by reference. What this means is that in <code>Fuss</code>, <code>l</code> is an alias for storage location used as a parameter to invoke the method. To be clear:</p>

<pre><code>public void Fuss(ref List&lt;int&gt; l)
</code></pre>

<p>called by</p>

<pre><code>List&lt;int&gt; list = new List&lt;int&gt; \{ 1, 2, 3 \};
Fuss(list);
</code></pre>

<p>Now, in <code>Fuss</code>, <code>l</code> is an alias for <code>list</code>. In particular, if you assign a new instance of <code>List&lt;int&gt;</code> to <code>l</code>, the caller will see that new instance assigned to the variable <code>list</code> as well. In particular, if you say</p>

<pre><code>public void Fuss(ref List&lt;int&gt; l) \{
    l = new List&lt;int&gt; \{ 1 \};
\}
</code></pre>

<p>then the caller will now see a list with one element. But if you say</p>

<pre><code>public void Fuss(List&lt;int&gt; l) \{
    l = new List&lt;int&gt; \{ 1 \};
\}
</code></pre>

<p>and call by</p>

<pre><code>List&lt;int&gt; list = new List&lt;int&gt; \{ 1, 2, 3 \};
Fuss(list);
</code></pre>

<p>then the caller will still see <code>list</code> as having three elements.</p>

<p>Clear?</p>

title: Splitting a text file twice in Ruby
body:
<p>Load it with the CSV parser from the standard library:</p>

<pre><code>require &#39csv&#39
a = CSV.open(&#39x.csv&#39).map \{ |r| r.map(&amp;:strip) \}
</code></pre>

<p>The will give you an <code>a</code> like this:</p>

<pre><code>[
    [ "bob jones",   "19", "moore reef", "yes", "no"  ],
    [ "jenny smith", "21", "reef park",  "yes", "yes" ],
    [ "any body",    "12", "somewhere",  "no",  "no"  ]
]
</code></pre>

<p>Then you can use <a href="http://www.ruby-doc.org/core/classes/Array.html#M000261" rel="nofollow"><code>b = a.transpose</code></a> to flip the rows and columns to get this in <code>b</code>:</p>

<pre><code>[
    [ "bob jones", "jenny smith", "any body" ],
    [ "19", "21", "12" ],
    [ "moore reef", "reef park", "somewhere" ],
    [ "yes", "yes", "no" ],
    [ "no", "yes", "no" ]
]
</code></pre>

<p>And then from there you can pull out the individual arrays if you want them:</p>

<pre><code>names, ages, destinations, flags1, flags2 = *b
</code></pre>

<p>I had to guess the <code>flags1</code> and <code>flags2</code> names.</p>

title: Qt: how do I highlight duplicated items in QListWidget? (qtjambi)
body:
<p>I usually use maps for those kinds of tasks:</p>

<pre><code>private final class DelegateValuesStorage \{
    private final Map&lt;Object, Integer&gt; values = new HashMap&lt;Object, Integer&gt;();

    ....

    //Add value or increase a count if exists
    public void add(final Object value) \{
       Integer count = values.get(value);
       if (count == null) \{
          values.put(value, 1);
       \} else \{
          values.put(value, count + 1);
       \}
    \}

    ....

    //Decrease a count or remove value if it doesn&#39t exist anymore
    public void decreaseCount(final Object value) \{
        if(value == null) \{
            return;
        \}
        Integer count = values.get(value);
        if (count == null) \{
            // decreasing a "new" value - could be an error too
            return;
        \}
        if (count &lt;= 1) \{
            // remove the value from the map
            values.remove(value);
        \} else \{
            values.put(value, count - 1);
        \}
    \}
\}
</code></pre>

<p>Highlighting now should be enabled if</p>

<pre><code>values.get(value) &gt; 1
</code></pre>

<p>is <code>true</code>.</p>

title: Crop/trim a JPG file with empty space with Java
body:
<p>It can be done in JAI as is demonstrated in <a href="http://www.java.net/node/668973" rel="nofollow">this thread</a>. Or here&#39s some Java code I just wrote which can be used to do it:</p>

<pre><code>public class TrimWhite \{
    private BufferedImage img;

    public TrimWhite(File input) \{
        try \{
            img = ImageIO.read(input);
        \} catch (IOException e) \{
            throw new RuntimeException( "Problem reading image", e );
        \}
    \}

    public void trim() \{
        int width  = getTrimmedWidth();
        int height = getTrimmedHeight();

        BufferedImage newImg = new BufferedImage(width, height,
                BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);
        Graphics g = newImg.createGraphics();
        g.drawImage( img, 0, 0, null );
        img = newImg;
    \}

    public void write(File f) \{
        try \{
            ImageIO.write(img, "bmp", f);
        \} catch (IOException e) \{
            throw new RuntimeException( "Problem writing image", e );
        \}
    \}

    private int getTrimmedWidth() \{
        int height       = this.img.getHeight();
        int width        = this.img.getWidth();
        int trimmedWidth = 0;

        for(int i = 0; i &lt; height; i++) \{
            for(int j = width - 1; j &gt;= 0; j--) \{
                if(img.getRGB(j, i) != Color.WHITE.getRGB() &amp;&amp;
                        j &gt; trimmedWidth) \{
                    trimmedWidth = j;
                    break;
                \}
            \}
        \}

        return trimmedWidth;
    \}

    private int getTrimmedHeight() \{
        int width         = this.img.getWidth();
        int height        = this.img.getHeight();
        int trimmedHeight = 0;

        for(int i = 0; i &lt; width; i++) \{
            for(int j = height - 1; j &gt;= 0; j--) \{
                if(img.getRGB(i, j) != Color.WHITE.getRGB() &amp;&amp;
                        j &gt; trimmedHeight) \{
                    trimmedHeight = j;
                    break;
                \}
            \}
        \}

        return trimmedHeight;
    \}

    public static void main(String[] args) \{
        TrimWhite trim = new TrimWhite(new File("...E&#39\\&#39E&#39\\&#39someInput.bmp"));
        trim.trim();
        trim.write(new File("...E&#39\\&#39E&#39\\&#39someOutput.bmp"));
    \}
\}
</code></pre>

title: Best method of getting Javascript data from a simple 3-row CSV
body:
<p>Try this. It will handle simple CSV, and single- or double-quoted CSV, all via the regex pattern in the code below. You&#39ll have to adjust the end of <code>processCSV()</code> to do what you want, since I&#39m just returning the object into thin air.</p>

<pre><code>$(document).ready(function() \{
    $.ajax(\{
        type: "GET",
        url: "my_csv.txt",
        dataType: "text",
        success: function(data) \{processCSV(data);\}
     \});
 \});

function processCSV(allLines) \{
    var allLinesArray = allLines.split(/E&#39\\&#39rE&#39\\&#39n|E&#39\\&#39n/);
    var leaguetable = \{ &#39building&#39: [], &#39percent&#39: [], &#39change&#39: [] \};
    var pattern = /([^,&#39"]*"[^"]*"[^,&#39"]*)|([^,&#39"]*&#39[^&#39]*&#39[^,&#39"]*)|([^,"&#39]*)/ig;
    var fieldValues;

    for (var i=0; i&lt;allLinesArray.length; i++) \{
        fieldValues = allLinesArray[i].match(pattern);
        if (fieldValues) \{
            for (var j=0; j&lt;fieldValues.length; j++) \{
                // if begins with single- or double-quote, strip specified quotes
                if (fieldValues[j].charAt(0) === &#39"&#39 || fieldValues[j].charAt(0) === "&#39") \{
                    fieldValues[j] = fieldValues[j].replace(fieldValues[j].substr(0,1), "");
                \}
            \}
            // I&#39ll trust your CSV to have the right number of fields, but...
            // you may want to build some validation in before doing the next 3 lines
            leaguetable.building.push(fieldValues[1]);
            leaguetable.percent.push(fieldValues[2]);
            leaguetable.change.push(fieldValues[3]);
        \}
    \}
    return leaguetable;
\}
</code></pre>

title: Hash table implementation for GPU
body:
<p>When I wrote an OpenCL kernel to create a simple hash table for strings, I used the hash algorithm from <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/q/785091/324625">Java&#39s String.hashCode()</a>, and then just modded that over the number of rows in the table to get a row index. </p>

<h3>Hashing function</h3>

<pre><code>uint getWordHash(__global char* str, uint len) \{
  uint hash = 0, multiplier = 1;
  for(int i = len - 1; i &gt;= 0; i--) \{
    hash += str[i] * multiplier;
    int shifted = multiplier &lt;&lt; 5;
    multiplier = shifted - multiplier;
  \}
  return hash;
\}
</code></pre>

<h3>Indexing</h3>

<pre><code>uint hash = getWordHash(word, len);
uint row = hash % nRows;
</code></pre>

<p>I handled collisions manually of course, and this approach worked well when I knew the number of strings ahead of time. </p>

title: Integer Partition in Java
body:
<p>You are mixing up your <code>holder</code> array inside the <code>if</code> branch which you shouldn&#39t do. Try the following:</p>

<pre><code>public static void partition(int n, int max, String temp, ArrayList&lt;ArrayList&lt;Integer&gt;&gt; master, ArrayList&lt;Integer&gt; holder) \{
    if (n == 0) \{
        ArrayList&lt;Integer&gt; temp1 = new ArrayList&lt;Integer&gt;();
        for (int i = 0; i &lt; holder.size(); i++) \{
            temp1.add(holder.get(i));
        \}
        master.add(temp1);
        System.out.println(temp);
    \}

    for (int i = Math.min(max, n); i &gt;= 1; i--) \{
        holder.add(i);
        partition(n - i, i, temp + " " + i, master, holder);
        holder.remove(holder.size() - 1);
    \}
\}
</code></pre>
